sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
By the Queene. The Queenes Maiestie consideryng to what extremities a great number of her subiectes are growen, by excesse in apparell, both contrary to the lawes of the realme, and to the disorder and confusion of the degrees of all states ... Proclamations. 1566-02-12 England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)
3 sheets
In Powles Churchyarde, by Rycharde Iugge and Iohn Cawood: Printers to the Queenes Maiestie, Imprinted at London : [1566]
A proclamation against excess of apparel. Publication date from STC. At foot of sheet 3: Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis. Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
=======
